sen.j: エトナ映画社（-えいがしゃ、1934年9月 設立 - 1935年4月 解散）は、かつて京都に存在した映画会社である。
sen.e: Etona Eiga-sha (established in September 1934, liquidated in April 1935) was a movie company once existed in Kyoto.
Etona Eiga-sha (established September 1934, liquidated April 1935) was a film company that existed in Kyoto.
Etona Eiga-sha (established September 1934, liquidated April 1935) was a film company that existed in Kyoto.

sen.j: サイレント映画を主体に、トーキーも製作したが、半年という短命に終わった。
sen.e: The company mainly produced silent films along with some talkie films, but it was liquidated only half a year after its establishment.
It mainly produced silent films, as well as a few talkie films, but was liquidated only half a year after its establishment.
sen.cmt: changed "The company" to "It" since this is the same paragraph as above; fixed grammar
sen.e: It mainly produced silent films, as well as a few talkie films, but was liquidated only half a year after its establishment.

sen.j: かつて1925年（大正14年）に東亜キネマから独立した牧野省三が設立したマキノ・プロダクションが、等持院撮影所を東亜に譲り渡したさいに建設した御室撮影所を、同社の解散後、1932年（昭和7年）の正映マキノキネマや宝塚キネマが相次いで稼動させたが、いずれも解散した。
sen.e: Omuro Studio, a film studio which Makino Production, a company that was established by Shozo MAKINO in 1925 when he became independent from Toa Kinema, constructed when it assigned Tojiin Studio to Toa, was taken over by Shoei Makino Kinema and Takarazuka Kinema after it was liquidated, but both companies were liquidated.

After the liquidation of Makino Productions, a company established by Shozo MAKINO in 1925 when he became independent from Toa Kinema, operations of the Omuro Studio it had built when handing over Tojiin Studio to Toa were taken over by Shoei Makino Kinema and then Takarazuka Kinema in 1932, but both of these companies went into liquidation as well.
sen.cmt: I needed to redo this translation to make it work. The description within a description was too difficult to read.
sen.e: After the liquidation of Makino Productions, a company established by Shozo MAKINO in 1925 when he became independent from Toa Kinema, operations of the Omuro Studio it had built when handing over Tojiin Studio to Toa were taken over by Shoei Makino Kinema and then Takarazuka Kinema in 1932, but both of these companies went into liquidation as well.

sen.j: 1934年（昭和9年）9月に田中伊助が出資して設立したのがこの「エトナ映画社」で、同撮影所を「エトナ映画京都撮影所」と改称して、映画を製作した。
sen.e: Isuke TANAKA established "Etona Eiga-sha" in 1934 and began producing films at this studio after renaming it "Etona Eiga Kyoto Studio".
Isuke TANAKA established "Etona Eiga-sha" in 1934 and began producing films at the studio after renaming it "Etona Eiga Kyoto Studio."
Isuke TANAKA established 'Etona Eiga-sha' in 1934 and began producing films at the studio after renaming it 'Etona Eiga Kyoto Studio.'

sen.j: 宝塚キネマから同地に残った後藤岱山や、市川右太衛門プロダクション（右太プロ）から来た稲葉蛟児といったマキノ・プロダクション出身の監督をかかえ、マキノの敏腕宣伝部長都村健を宣伝部長に迎えた。
sen.e: The company received film directors originated from Makino Production, such as Taisan GOTO of Takarazuka Kinema and Koji INABA of Ichikawa Utaemon Production (Uta Puro), and appointed Ken TSUMURA, Makino's able advertising manager, as its advertising manager.

The company employed film directors originally from Makino Productions such as Taisan GOTO of Takarazuka Kinema and Koji INABA of Ichikawa Utaemon Productions (Uta Puro), and Ken TSUMURA, Makino Productions' able advertising manager, was appointed as advertising manager.
sen.cmt: changed "received" to "employed" for "かかえ"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The company employed film directors originally from Makino Productions such as Taisan GOTO of Takarazuka Kinema and Koji INABA of Ichikawa Utaemon Productions (Uta Puro), and Ken TSUMURA, Makino Productions' able advertising manager, was appointed as advertising manager.

sen.j: 撮影部は1930年（昭和5年）にマキノ・プロダクションを大道具の河合広始とともに退社、太秦の双ヶ丘に撮影所を建設し「日本キネマ撮影所」を設立した田中十三とその一派の岸雅夫が主力となった。
sen.e: Key persons of its filming department were Juzo TANAKA, a person who resigned from Makino Production in 1930 along with a stage carpenter Hiroshi KAWAI and established "Nihon Kinema Studio" at Uzumasa Narabigaoka, and his colleague Masao KISHI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Key members of the filming department were Masao KISHI and his colleague Juzo TANAKA, who resigned from Makino Productions in 1930 along with the stage carpenter Hiroshi KAWAI and established "Nihon Kinema Studio" at Uzumasa Narabigaoka.
sen.cmt: changed "person" to "members"; moved "Masao KISHI" to the front of the sentence since it was awkward having him at the end after a long description;
sen.e: Key members of the filming department were Masao KISHI and his colleague Juzo TANAKA, who resigned from Makino Productions in 1930 along with the stage carpenter Hiroshi KAWAI and established 'Nihon Kinema Studio' at Uzumasa Narabigaoka.

sen.j: 脚本部では日活京都出身の野村雅延が主力となった。
sen.e: A key person of its scenario department was Masanobu NOMURA from Nikkatsu Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: A key member to the scenario department was Masanobu NOMURA from Nikkatsu Kyoto.
sen.cmt: changed "person" to "member"; changed "of its" to "to the";
sen.e: A key member to the scenario department was Masanobu NOMURA from Nikkatsu Kyoto.

sen.j: 俳優部では右太プロでは浅香麗三郎、河合映画製作社では燕東三郎と名乗った綾野小路絃三郎、宝塚キネマから来た水原洋一や鳥人・高木新平、新興キネマの五十鈴桂子らが主力となった。
sen.e: Key persons of its players department were Genzaburo AYANOKOJI, a person who called himself Reizabro ASAKA at Uta Puro and Tozabro TSUBAME at Kawai Eiga Seisakusha, Yoichi MIZUHARA from Takarazuka Kinema, a birdman Shinpei TAKAGI and Keiko ISUZU from Shinko Kinema
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Key members of the players department were Tozaburo TSUBAME and Genzaburo AYANOKOJI, who called himself Reizaburo ASAKA, from Kawai Eiga Seisakusha, Yoichi MIZUHARA from Takarazuka Kinema and an aviator named Shinpei TAKAGI, as well as Keiko ISUZU from Shinko Kinema.
sen.cmt: Tozabro→Tozaburo; moved "Tozaburo TSUBAME" to before "Genzaburo AYANOKOJI"; changed "birdman" to "aviator" for "鳥人"; It looks to me like the aviator Shinpei TAKAGI is also from Takarazuka Kinema, but I wasn't sure, so I left it as written in translation 1
sen.e: Key members of the players department were Tozaburo TSUBAME and Genzaburo AYANOKOJI, who called himself Reizaburo ASAKA, from Kawai Eiga Seisakusha, Yoichi MIZUHARA from Takarazuka Kinema and an aviator named Shinpei TAKAGI, as well as Keiko ISUZU from Shinko Kinema.

sen.j: 9本の映画を製作したが、設立半年後の1935年（昭和10年）4月には解散した。
sen.e: The company produced nine films, but it was liquidated in April 1935, half a year after its establishment.
The company produced nine films, but was liquidated half a year after its establishment in April of 1935.
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more smoothly
sen.e: The company produced nine films, but was liquidated half a year after its establishment in April of 1935.

sen.j: 解散後の稲葉、後藤、綾野小路は極東映画社へ、田中はフリーランスに、水原はマキノ雅弘のマキノトーキー製作所へ、五十鈴は大都映画を経て極東へ、高木は地方巡業の旅に出た。
sen.e: After the company was liquidated, Inaba, Goto, Ayanokoji joined Kyokuto Eiga-sha, Tanaka turned freelance, Mizuhara joined Masahiro MAKINO's Makino Talkie Seisakusho and Takagi began road show.

After the company was liquidated, Inaba, Goto and Ayanokoji joined Kyokuto Eiga-sha, Tanaka turned freelance, Mizuhara joined Masahiro MAKINO's company called Makino Talkie Seisakusho and Takagi began doing road shows.
sen.cmt: added "company called" before "Makino Talkie Seisakusho"; fixed grammar
sen.e: After the company was liquidated, Inaba, Goto and Ayanokoji joined Kyokuto Eiga-sha, Tanaka turned freelance, Mizuhara joined Masahiro MAKINO's company called Makino Talkie Seisakusho and Takagi began doing road shows.

sen.j: 宣伝部長の都村は通信合同社に入りジャーナリストの道を歩んだ。
sen.e: Advertizing manager Tsumura joined Gpdo Tsushin-sha Company and became a journalist.
Advertising manager Tsumura joined the company called Godo Tsushin-sha and became a journalist.
sen.cmt: Advertizing→Advertising; Gpdo→Godo; changed "Godo Tsushin-sha" to "Tsushin Godo-sha" for "通信合同社"; changed "Company" to "the company called";
sen.e: Advertising manager Tsumura joined the company called Tsushin Godo-sha and became a journalist.
sen.cmt: Godo Tsushin-shaをTsushin Godo-shaに変更しましｔ

sen.j: 2004年（平成16年）6月11日、同社の全容判明との記事が「京都新聞」に掲載された。
sen.e: On June 2004, "Kyoto Shimbun" carried an article concerning the details of the company.
In June of 2004, the "Kyoto Shimbun" carried an article describing the details of the company.
sen.cmt: changed "concerning the details" to "describing the details"; fixed grammar
sen.e: In June 11 of 2004, the 'Kyoto Shimbun' carried an article describing the details of the company.
sen.cmt: 11を挿入しました。" "を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 名称 エトナ映画社
sen.e: Copany name : Etona Eiga-sha
Company name: Etona Eiga-sha
Company name: Etona Eiga-sha

sen.j: 所在地 京都市右京区花園天授ヶ丘（現在の同市同区花園天授ケ岡町）
sen.e: Adress : Hanazono Tenjugaoka, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City (currently, Hanazono Tenjugaoka-machi, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City)
Address: Hanazono Tenjugaoka, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City (currently, Hanazono Tenjugaoka-machi, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City)
Address: Hanazono Tenjugaoka, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City (currently, Hanazono Tenjugaoka-machi, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City)
Representative : Isuke TANAKA
Representative: Isuke TANAKA
Representative: Isuke TANAKA
Advertizing manager : Ken TSUMURA
